reason: Returned from 10-month layoff with promising 2nd; now fitter and lightly raced. Track and trip suit. Market leaders have stamina doubts or inconsistent profiles.
Significant trip drop with first-time blinkers. Ran respectably over too far last time. Favourites have inconsistent form on soft going or course.
Dropped to a winnable mark; back class and suited by this trip on soft. Forgive visor debut. Front of market includes unproven quick turnaround runners.
Point winner with solid bumper run; quietly progressive. Pedigree and conditions suit. Favourites have shown jumping errors or regression on soft ground.
Significant drop in class and distance; track specialist. Shaped better than result last time. With pace collapse, could grab place at huge odds.
Lightly raced with a turn of foot on AW; turf debut but bred for it. Trainer rarely wastes a travel, and ground should suit.
Old-timer with 90+ RPR at peak; not far behind in recent course effort. Drops to Class 6 and can pick up pieces late. Market underestimates on past class.
Back in form, recent win off higher mark, proven in big fields. Ground suits and pace to run at. Market overreacts to class rise.
Massive price for horse with back-form in this grade. Cheekpieces could spark improvement. Weakness in favs with patchy profiles.
Well-bred debutante from a yard in form; stable's 2yo strike-rate is solid. Could be significantly overpriced if tuned up.
Trainer won this race last year with a similar profile runner. Quiet pedigree potential and could take a step forward if fancied in betting.
Already raced and not disgraced; smaller field helps. Connections known for unlocking improvement in second starts.
Lightly raced 3yo with decent middle-distance pedigree. Trainer has late bloomers; could go well on turf debut at a huge price.
Poor AW form but breeding suggests better on turf. Small field and slow pace scenario could see him travel well and pick up pieces late.
Forgive latest run when hampered; prior form at track fair. Lightly raced for yard, can go well under 5lb claimer on heavy ground. Field lacks depth behind top 3.
Not a prolific winner but proven Beverley performer; drop in grade with ideal ground. Most rivals inconsistent or unreliable. Massive price for course-placed horse.
Big drop in trip should help after hanging over longer. Blinkers on and stamina-laden pedigree gives chance in a muddling small field. Most rivals exposed.
Only 5 starts; shaped with promise on seasonal return. Stable often improves runners second time up. Could stay this trip well on decent ground.
Held up and never landed a blow last time but better judged on previous runs at Galway. Small field could suit run style. Trainer has fair strike rate here.
Unexposed hurdler switching back to the Flat. Stayed on well in maiden hurdles and may enjoy 1m5f trip. Yard has popped in longshot winners before at Ballinrobe.
